case_vignette: A 17-year-old male presents with a several year history of a spot on the neck that developed acute onset pain for the past 3 days and warmth! On examination along the left lateral neck is a tender, soft skin colored nodule! Biopsy is performed and reveals stratified squamous epithelium with surrounding lymphoid tissue!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painful and warm spot on my neck that's been hurting more over the past 3 days.
Is the area red or swollen?
Yes, the spot is tender and feels swollen.
Have you had any fever or feeling of general unwellness recently?
No, I haven't had a fever or felt generally unwell recently.
Have you had this kind of symptom before, or is it the first time?
I've had the spot on my neck for several years, but the pain and warmth started just three days ago.
Do you have any chronic health issues or are you currently on any medications?
No, I don't have any chronic health issues and I'm not on any medications.
Has anyone in your family had similar symptoms or a history of skin issues?
No, no one in my family has had similar symptoms or a history of skin issues.
Final Diagnosis: Abscess
